# isLockingFocusWithCustomLensPositionSupported

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the device supports locking focus to a specific lens position.

## Declaration

```swift
var isLockingFocusWithCustomLensPositionSupported: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

If this property’s value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], calling the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/setFocusModeLocked(lensPosition:completionHandler:)] method with a lens position value other than [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/currentLensPosition] raises an exception.

## Setting focus manually

- **lensPosition**: The current focus position of the lens.
- **currentLensPosition**: A constant that represents the current lens position.
- **setFocusModeLocked(lensPosition:completionHandler:)**: Locks the lens position at the specified value, and sets the focus mode to a locked state.
